article.headline: Southern Miss 61, Tulane 60
article.story: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) -- Southern Mississippi won its first game since late December and did it without its leading scorer and rebounder. Dwane Brown made a lay-up with two minutes remaining to lift Southern Miss to a 61-60 win over Tulane on Saturday, snapping a six-game losing streak. Southern Miss coach Larry Eustachy announced after the game that junior forward Jasper Johnson, who averaged 15.5 points and 7.4 rebounds per game, is no longer on the team. "Jasper never really bought into how I thought the game would be played," Eustachy said. "I met with Jasper, and mutually, we thought it was best that we parted ways." Rashaad Carruth and Michael Ford helped Southern Miss deal with the loss of Johnson. They led the way with 19 points each and Southern Mississippi (10-8, 1-5 Conference USA) won for the first time since Dec. 28 against William Carey, an NAIA school. Quincy Davis scored 18 points for Tulane (7-10, 1-5). "It was a great win," Eustachy said. "The team needed it and I needed it. I think that's the hardest, most determined we've played all year. I'm proud of our team." Brown's lay-up gave Southern Miss a 61-56 lead, but two free-throws from Tulane's Ben Benfield made the score 61-58 with 1:36 left. Southern Miss had a chance to seal the win in the final minute, but Ford missed a turnaround jumper with 45 seconds left and committed a turnover with 10.3 seconds remaining. That gave Tulane another chance, but Taylor Rochestie missed a game-tying 3-pointer and David Gomez scored on the missed shot with little time left for another shot. Southern Miss fought back from a second-half deficit, tying the game at 43 on two free throws from Dante Stiggers with 10:34 remaining. The Golden Eagles took their largest lead of five on two occasions, on a 3-point basket by Carruth with 2:45 to play, and again on Brown's lay-up. Tulane led 28-25 at halftime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
